events.eventSummary: A new trend in crypto scam involves individuals posing as police to steal millions. Sources: https://beincrypto.com/crypto-scammers-impersonate-police-officers/

events.entities: Washington Post Employee Data Exposed in Oracle Breach
events.eventSummary: The Washington Post is notifying nearly 10,000 employees and contractors that some of their personal and financial data has been exposed in the Oracle data theft attack. Sources: https://bsky.app/profile/bleepingcomputer.com/post/3m5jjy7tcus2b

events.entities: FUCASA Breach by Qillin Hacking Group
events.eventSummary: Qillin hacking group claims to have breached Fundidora de Cananea S.A. de C.V. (FUCASA). Sources: https://bsky.app/profile/hackmanac.com/post/3m5jiwdh7rp25
Coinbase Cartel hacking group claims to have breached PACCAR. Sources: https://bsky.app/profile/hackmanac.com/post/3m5jdhpkodn2f
Coinbase Cartel hacking group claims to have breached Cinvestav (Centro de Investigaci√≥n y de Estudios Avanzados). Sources: https://bsky.app/profile/hackmanac.com/post/3m5jdxfq4v32d

dailyBrief: Today's cyber landscape is marked by a significant breach impacting The Washington Post, exposing sensitive data of almost 10,000 individuals due to the Oracle data theft attack. Threat groups, including Qillin and Coinbase Cartel, have claimed successful breaches against FUCASA, PACCAR, and Cinvestav, highlighting ongoing risks for corporate entities. Additionally, a rising crypto scam involves criminals impersonating police officers to steal millions, underscoring evolving social engineering tactics. The volume and severity of attacks point to an elevated threat environment, with particular concern for breaches leaking personal and financial information.
